docs.snippet: President Trump is moving to fulfill one of his central campaign promises, but a get-tough stance with China could reverberate badly in the nation’s heartland.

headline.main: Farmers’ Anger at Trump Tariffs Puts Republican Candidates in a Bind
headline.print_headline: Farmers Tense  And G.O.P. Torn  Over Trade War

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and ANA SWANSON

docs.snippet: Tech firms, military contractors, carmakers, cellphone companies, financial firms, sports leagues and Wall Street giants are all in his Twitter cross hairs.

headline.main: Amazon Has Lots of Company as Trump Slams ‘Stupid’ Businesses
headline.print_headline: Firms Shudder as Trump’s Tweets Mean Business

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and CECILIA KANG

docs.snippet: President Trump says Amazon costs the U.S.P.S. billions of dollars. But the available evidence is far less certain, and some of it suggests the opposite.

headline.main: Is Amazon Bad for the Postal Service? Or Its Savior?
headline.print_headline: Trump Chides A Package Deal, But Is He Right?

docs.snippet: President Trump has begun a new push for legislation to crack down on illegal immigration and make it more difficult to obtain refuge in the United States, White House officials said Monday.

headline.main: Trump’s Immigration Tweets Followed by Policy Plans to Match
headline.print_headline: Trump Returns To a Hard Line On Immigrants

docs.snippet: If the tariffs stand, along with China’s retaliatory moves, they could damage industries that have relied on a global supply chain for their recovery.

headline.main: In Sparing Consumers Tariff Burden, Trump Hit Manufacturing
headline.print_headline: U.S. Risks Trapping Manufacturers in the Crossfire

byline.original: By NATALIE KITROEFF and BEN CASSELMAN

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump will host French President Emmanuel Macron at a private dinner at Mount Vernon as part of a state visit later this month.

headline.main: Trump to Dine With Macron at Mount Vernon
headline.print_headline: Trump to Dine With Macron at Mount Vernon

docs.snippet: The stock market continued to plunge Monday, as investors were unnerved by the unpredictable White House. Stocks are now down 4 percent this year.

headline.main: Markets That Climbed the Trump Bump Are Tumbling Down From It
headline.print_headline: Stocks Sink As a Bump Gives Way To a Bear

docs.snippet: President Trump denied knowledge of a $130,000 payment to Stephanie Clifford, a pornographic film actress known as Stormy Daniels. It was the first time he commented publicly on the scandal.

headline.main: Trump Speaks About Stormy Daniels Scandal
